attributes.comment:
Dear Sir/Madam:
I continue to be dismayed at your department's desire to raise the fees associated
with foerign adoptions. IInternational adoption is an expensive endeavor to begin
with and your department is not helping any. Moreover, I have always viewed your
desire to charge the American taxpayer for services that we are already paying for
through our taxes as redundant. Since I already pay my taxes, your
fees are similar to "double dipping" into my pocket book.

Please, dispense with the fees hikes. Rather, I would like to see your deparment
extend the deadline for re-fingerprinting since many of us who are adopting from
China now face long delays. What was once an 8 month wait has now turned into
a 16-18 month wait because China has slowed down the adoption process. An
extension would send a clear signal to the American public that the USCIS is
working on the behalf of the American citizen.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Andrew L. Norton
